intro: Erigeron jacinteus, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features blue to purple ray flowers surrounding a yellow disk. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Erigeron jacinteus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate.
